result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Shaun Durrah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 4.20.15 or if not paid, a civil judgment will be ordered.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
With credit for 160 days time served, and with Huber privileges for work, school and childcare. Defendant has a report date of 2.25.15 before 12pm.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Shaun Durrah

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Check Packet

Defendant Michael Shaun Durrah in court with attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant ordered to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit of 160 days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work, school and childcare.  Defendant has a report date of 2.25.15 before 12pm.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 4.20.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment will be ordered.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY as amended and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as amended in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Court addresses the Justice Point report.  Statements by defense.  Court admonishes the defendant as to following the rules.

Defendant Michael Shaun Durrah in court with attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 07.

On motion of the State, Court orders the penalty enhancer of "Repeater" DISMISSED. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.    lfc
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Michael Shaun Durrah in court with attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 7.  Plea hearing scheduled for 01-08-2015 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on December 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
As of 12/1 this case is being reassigned to Judge McAdams and will be set on his calendar.

Defendant Michael Shaun Durrah in court with attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Final Pretrial. For the reasons placed on the record the Court adjourns the case for Final Pretrial on 12-11-2014 at 8:30 a.m. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 1-21-2015 at 9:00 a.m., Br. 17. 
Note:  Court REITERATES that the defendant MAINTAIN Absolute Sobriety and NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.  No firearms or any dangerous weapons.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated November 3, 2014, received and filed.
State's Requested Jury Instructions, State's Witness List, and State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.

Defendant Michael Shaun Durrah in court with attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer.  Paul M. Hauer for Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Plea and Sentencing.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.  Copies given to state and defense counsel.  Court orders case adjourned for Final Pretrial on 11-4-2014 at 8:30 a.m. and Jury Trial on 1-21-2015 at 9:00 a.m., Br. 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated September 11, 2014, received and filed.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 9/12/2014 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Michael Shaun Durrah in court with attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court is currently in trial and unable to do the plea and sentencing.   Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Michael Shaun Durrah in court with attorney Gilbert F Urfer.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Parties are still in negotiations. Case rescheduled for PLEA and SENTENCING on 7/23/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Michael Shaun Durrah in court with attorney Gilbert F Urfer.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Matter in Court on defense motion to dismiss.
Sworn for the State: Officer Anthony Milone. State rests. Defense rests. After hearing testimony and argument, Court denies the defense Motion to Dismiss for the reasons stated on the record. Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 6/25/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Defendant Michael Durrah's Motion to Suppress Evidence, received and filed.

14RM008308  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
2/14/14 vf

Defendant Michael Shaun Durrah in court with attorney Gilbert F Urfer.  Defendant Michael Shaun Durrah in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense counsel requests a Motion Hearing date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 15.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Michael Shaun Durrah in court with attorney Gilbert F Urfer.  Defendant Michael Shaun Durrah in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Chad Boyack-MPD Officer.  Stipulation to previous conviction of the defendant in Milwaukee County case #11CF3484 is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Arraignment scheduled for February 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Michael Shaun Durrah in court with attorney Gregory Renden.  Defendant Michael Shaun Durrah in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
